subject: Management
title: The ADKAR Model
description: A fast breakdown of The ADKAR Model for builders.

hook.text: A manager pushed a new process. People knew about it but didn't want it. Knowledge without desire is useless.

buildup.text: Prosci's ADKAR model focuses on individual change: each person must go through five stages.

discovery.text: Awareness, Desire, Knowledge, Ability, Reinforcement. All five, in order, for each person.

twist.text: Most change programs jump to Knowledge (training) without building Awareness and Desire first.

climax.text: Diagnose where each person is stuck. Some need awareness. Others need ability. Tailor accordingly.

punchline.text: Change happens one person at a time. Meet each one where they are.

quiz.question: What does ADKAR stand for?
options: Awareness, Desire, Knowledge, Ability, and Reinforcement
Action, Development, Knowledge, Assessment, and Results
Alignment, Direction, Key metrics, Accountability, and Review
